title: Instagram Auto Converting Emoticons to Emojis
content:
Not sure if this is a silly question to ask, but I've noticed that when I use browser Instagram on Firefox it displays emoticons as emojis. For example if I type "<3" (less than 3) it'll display a heart emoji. It doesn't actually convert it In the message though, my friends say it sends what I type.

I'm just wondering why this is happening and how to stop it, I've checked settings for everything and cannot find anything about it. Thank you in advance.

title: Firefox won't open
content: Recently I'm having an issue with Firefox that makes it so when I try to open it, it simply refuses to do so. Say on my desktop I double click the icon it will open for a split second and then instantly close and refuse to do anything afterwards. This is very frustrating, and I haven't yet discovered a solution and would really like to be able to use Firefox again. What is really strange is that this is a persistent problem not only on my laptop but at my pc as well which are two separate devices. If anybody can help or has experience with this problem to offer incite it would deeply be appreciated.

title: Reviews on some shopping webpages are not showing
content: I shop on several websites, and the customer review section does not appear on the product pages. title: Search bar disappears when window fills half screen
content: Before the latest update whenever I made a browser window fill half the screen it would keep the search bar visible. Now it only keeps the address bar visible. Even after moving the search bar to the far left it still disappears unless I make the window slightly bigger, which is impractical. I just want to be able to quickly use other various search engines that I have installed as addons by pressing the up or down key, even when the window is half my screen again.

title: Firefox colour custom background not applying
content: So, I was using "Firefox Color" to design my own theme. All the block colours seem to work. However, there's an option for custom background, which the preview within the creator app shows nicely. When trying one image type, it notified me that it wasn't compatible and to choose another. So the one I chose should therefore be compatible and therefore would assume it should work. Yet, when the theme is applied, the custom background isn't there, just the block colour. Perhaps the block background colour is overriding the custom background? If so, though, I have no idea how to stop it from doing that so that I can actually see my custom one. Plz halp!
